description: These names have all been used to indicate a loud, full-toned 8' chorus Diapason. The name Major Principal has also been used as a synonym for Major Octave, and the name Grand Principal has been used as a synonym for Contra Principal. Chorus Diapason, Major Diapason and Stentor Diapason are mentioned only by Irwin, who lists them separately but states that they are practically synonymous. Grand Open Diapason is mentioned only by Sumner. The prefix Grand has also been used to indicate stops of sub-octave pitch.
examplesDescription: No examples of Grand Open Diapason are known. Contributions welcome.
